clinical_history: Pelvic pain with suspected ovarian pathology.
technique: Longitudinal, transverse, and oblique views obtained.
findings: Left kidney shows isoechoic, corticomedullary differentiation preserved.
Right ovary shows mildly heterogeneous appearance.
Gallbladder shows hypoechoic, no stones or wall thickening.
Common bile duct measures 10.37 mm, within normal limits.
Liver appears enlarged with no focal lesions.
